title: thanks league
body: just want to say thankyou to riot for giving me a chat restriction for calling someone a child when they were acting like a child, i like the fact you take the side of a petty brat because i took a ward kill as a support and they proceeded to rage and abandon our lane leaving me to 2v1 as a support. but no youre right in your undying wisdom that i was being negative. no really thanks.....

replies.body:
If it helps clarify for you, someone else being negative does not make your negativity ok. Two wrongs do not make a right, and under Riot's system, both wrongs will be punished, regardless of who started it.

Defending yourself is not the same as retaliating. One is fine ,might not help much, but is perfectly ok. The other is punishable. Don't stoop to their level, don't flame them because they flamed you.

It is only a chat restriction, it is a warning that your behaviour was unacceptable and a warning that if you continue to demonstrate that behaviour you will face harsher punishments.

https://www.facebook.com/loltyler1/?fref=ts

Tyler 1 can play again getting unbanned and play With TSM so doesn't all banned players get chance as well?
Tyler1 is an extreme case, and he as a player has been banned not just his account. He isn't getting any more chances.

Absolutely disgusting. A sickening condescension.
If someone feeds, trolls and flames me, I'm telling the %%%% to go fuck himself, and there is absolutely nothing wrong with that.
It's not meant to be condescending, it's meant to clarify what the system does. Just because you have been punished, does not mean they have not.

"someone else being negative does not make your negativity ok"
"Two wrongs do not make a right"
"it is a warning that your behaviour was unacceptable"

Spoken like a true rioter.
Why does riot feel the need to be some sort of overprotective parent, god forbid a a player gets their feelings hurt.
And yet from your post you seem to think your support rageing and abandoning you was not ok, does that not mean you felt his behaviour was unacceptable aka "had your feelings hurt"?

You could do that and face the consequences of being just as bad as them.

Or you have the option to tell them off for being rude in a nice way and mute them. Personally i like to give them a bit of logic, and then if they carry on its a mute.
